pageTitle: Cisco IOS First Hop Redundancy Protocols Command Reference - vrrp authentication through vrrs mac-address [Support] - Cisco
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {41257=The following example shows how to enable VRRP on Ethernet interface 0. The VRRP group is 1. IP address 10.0.1.20 is the address of the virtual router.}
textBeforeTable: Syntax Description seconds ] } } [ timeout key-string [ 0 | 7 ] key-chain | key-string { key-chain text-string | md5 { text-string | text authentication group vrrp no seconds ] } } [ timeout key-string [ 0 | 7 ] key-chain | key-string { key-chain text-string | md5 { text-string | text authentication group vrrp To authenticate Virtual Router Redundancy Protocol (VRRP) packets received from other routers in the group, use the vrrp authentication command in interface configuration mode. To disable VRRP authentication, use the no form of this command. vrrp authentication vrrs mac-address vrrs interface-state vrrs follow vrrs vrrp track vrrp timers learn vrrp timers advertise vrrp sso vrrp shutdown vrrp priority vrrp preempt vrrp name vrrp ip vrrp description vrrp delay vrrp authentication vrrp authentication through vrrs mac-address vrrs mac-address
textAfterTable: Note    The key-string authentication method is encrypted if the service password-encryption command has been specified. Command Default VRRP authentication is disabled.
